Correct meta viewport content syntax

The viewport content value should be comma-delimited, and it should not
have a final semicolon.

Chrome 31 gives warning messages about the current implementation:

    The value "1.0;" for key "initial-scale" was truncated to its numeric prefix.
    The value "1.0;" for key "maximum-scale" was truncated to its numeric prefix.
    The value "0;" for key "user-scalable" was truncated to its numeric prefix.
    Error parsing a meta element's content: ';' is not a valid key-value pair separator. Please use ',' instead.

This change fixes all 4 of those warnings.

Alex Gibson covers the proper syntax in ["Make sure to use correct meta
viewport syntax"][1]

[1] http://alxgbsn.co.uk/2011/11/23/make-sure-to-use-correct-meta-viewport-syntax/

Merge pull request #225 from SamWhited/patch-1

Add common LaTeX file extensions

Add common LaTeX file formats

Adds `dtx', 'cls', and `sty' files as LaTeX documents. DTX files are for documented sources and can be used to generate LaTeX class and package source files. `sty' and `cls' files are for packages and classes and can be generated by dtx files or written on their own. These files are the most likely use of docco in the TeX world.

Merge pull request #96 from jedschneider/wranguages

Moving language support to an external JSON formatted file.

Moving language support to an external JSON formatted file.

This should cut down on the noisiness of the patches for new language support and
also keep the static data out of the source code, since it will only grow.
Note about fork changes.

Tighten up block comment support for Javascript and Python:
 - Only support block comments that open at the beginning of a line (no inline docs, because we'd need a language parser to properly support them), and close at the end of a line.

Updates based on feedback:
 - Remove 'vendor' directory reference from install task.
 - Filter out unknown sources in document(), instead of generate_documentation(), to ensure template usage of sources only includes those that will be documented (e.g. 'Jump Page').

 Cleanup:
  - Remove usage of lib/docco in Cakefile, this can prevent building if the last compiled version has errors.
  - Remove 'weigh' task from Cakefile (it's cool but kind of unneeded)
Use built version of docco instead of src/docco in Cakefile, so that checking out older versions of docco.coffee doesn't break 'weigh' task.

Fix broken Coffee block comment parsing matchers.
 - `docco.coffee` runs properly with `-b` flag.
 - Update language tests to support variable numbers of expected comments per source type.
   * This addresses cases in which the single-line comment symbol overlaps with the block comments (e.g. # and ###).
     In the case of a coffee file with (1) single, and (1) block comment, if parsed without `-b`, the file will pick up (3) comments, instead of (1), because it matches the begin/end block comment lines as single-line comments (`#`##).

Add Docco.parse to the exported API functions.
 - Use Docco.parse in Cakefile task `weigh` to print out `docco.src` Code/Docs line information.
Update docs.
Update test comments
Update docs about block comment support.

Deal gracefully with source files of unknown type (skip, don't crash and burn)
- This allows docco to run over folders with wildcards, and not blow up when encountering a file it can't document.  Print an error to the console, and continue to iterate over sources.
Merge branch 'block-comments'

Add more thorough testing for block comment support:
 - add missing language tests : .c/.h
 - run language tests serially to avoid output conflicts (c.c/c.h -> c.html)
 - test that block comments are ignored when options.blocks is false

Add support for block comments to all languages docco recognizes.
 - Add tests to verify single/block comments are parsed properly.
Update resources/README.md
Move pagelet into resources, and update the readme to describe the default docco template and css files
Rename pagelet readme so that github recognizes it as markdown.
Merge branch 'gh-pages'

Cleanup:
- Consistency in constant naming (defaults vs DEFAULTS).
- Wildcard regex matches begin/end string properly.

Cleanup test documentation, and file mess from examples directory.
- Remove examples path, move pagelet template into resources/

Some cleanup in tests, comments in cmd.coffee
Fix template error in pagelet.jst

Add basic testing to Docco:
 - Borrow the tiny test runner from CoffeeScript.
 - Basic tests for documenting Docco itself, and exercising all configuration options.

 Add examples folder:
 - Add a pagelet template example, that includes only divs and no HTML wrapper.
 - Add various hello world language examples in the 'basic' folder

 Cleanup Documentation
 - Update index.html page
 - Document public API usage

 Bugs
 - Fix issue where 'docco.css' was hardcoded in the default template.  Use the properly specified css file (defaults to docco.css)
 - Use fs.writeFileSync in generate_html so that tests can access files consistently when Docco completion callback is invoked (opt to use sync API for simplicity, and not having to update all the existing functions to use async callbacks-less code change)

Add basic testing to Docco (using CoffeeScript's tiny-testing solution)
- WIP

Add support for running Docco via an exported public API:
 - run(args=process.argv) : Run Docco from the command line
 - document(sources,options,callback) : Run Docco over a list of source wildcard matches, with the specified options, with an optional completion callback
 - resolve_source(source) : Useful utility for resolving a source input (supports wildcards) to a list of matched files.

 Add Docco configurable options:
 - use commander.js for command line option parsing, and usage output generation.  (Tried to borrow CoffeeScript optparser, but it's not exposed.)
 - add options for specifying what jst template to use, which css file to copy, and what output folder to use.

Misc
 - Update docco binary to invoke Docco.run() rather than just requiring the library.

Add command line coffee file (second file, drats!):
In order to be able to use docco outside of a direct command line invocation, the main Docco file cannot automatically process the argv and run.  It needed to export an API that can be used to run it from the command line, as well as directly from within another application.  The good news is that this second file is really just for convenience for developers running Docco directly.  e.g. "coffee src/cmd -t myproj/custom_template.jst src/*.coffee")

Add simple, configurable options to docco, and use package.json dependencies for installation of vendor libraries.
- Use commander.js for parsing command line options.
   * An alternative could be used, but commander.js is tested, cleanly implemented, and has a npm package.json.
- Optionally specify a custom output path, css file, jst template, or a combination of the three.
- Install vendor libraries as npm package dependencies (showdown, coffee-script and commander).
